name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Later, some Chinese audience members went to negotiate with the audience members holding the flag. It was rumored online that the Chinese audience members finally tore down the flag, but there were no more videos or pictures to confirm this.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Later, Chinese audience members at the scene negotiated with the audience holding the flag. Video 2

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Subsequent update: The Nanning Municipal Party Committee decided to suspend and investigate five people, including the deputy president of the relevant court, the director and deputy director of the executive bureau, the party committee of the bus company, and the secretary of the party branch of Huibo Parking Lot.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Netizens added that in fact, a large number of public accounts disguised as private accounts that are currently required to be forwarded and followed internally are actually operated by the government and official media.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On May 21, a video of He Saifei, a Chinese actress, national first-class actress, and Yue Opera performing artist, angrily criticizing the cultural department went viral on the Internet.
In the program, when she learned that an excellent opera actor only earned 1,500 yuan a month and had to rely on driving an online car-hailing service to raise three children, she angrily scolded: "You keep talking about the Plum Blossom Award and the Wenhua Award, spending millions and tens of millions to rehearse the play, and after winning the award, the people can't see it. Where is the play? Where is the money? Where is it? The people can't see it! Even if you arrest me, I will tell you! I went to film a TV series because the troupe couldn't arrange a play..."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In a subsequent update, a netizen posted on Bilibili that he had snatched the flag after the game.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On the morning of May 22, on the streets of Xi'an.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On the morning of May 22, residents of Kangyi Huafu Community in Lianyungang gathered to protest because the parking area was reduced and the greening was insufficient, which was inconsistent with the previous commitment.
During the process, someone was stopped by the police during the live broadcast, saying "You have the right to take pictures, but you can't cut off the beginning and end and fabricate..." The live broadcast was then closed

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Sun Yat-sen University’s “Ten Don’ts” for Classroom Teaching

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Another "insulting the military" storm
Recently, many self-media outlets have pointed their spearheads at contemporary artist Yue Minjun, accusing his works of "vilifying and insulting the People's Liberation Army" and "violating the Heroes and Martyrs Law."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Later, a Weibo user posted that the flag was burned by himself.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Teachers at Taizhou University in Zhejiang Province asked graduating students to fill out a questionnaire about their employment situation and provided "standard answers".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
User contribution
Guilin University of Electronic Technology issued a notice requiring that every course should include "ideological and political education in courses", even science and engineering courses are no exception.
And questionnaires will be sent to students for supervision.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Netizen added: Sun Yat-sen University graduates said that the reason why Sun Yat-sen University posted the "Ten Prohibitions" was because a few years ago someone left comments related to the "June 4th Incident" in many classrooms in the teaching building.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On May 22, a group calling itself "Russian Legion of Freedom" posted a video on their Telegram channel announcing the uprising.
"It's time to end the Kremlin dictatorship! Be brave, don't be afraid, because we are going home! Russia will be free!" they said after criticizing the Putin regime.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On May 22, the very influential public account "No. 1 Post" in the military published an article promoting the "self-service application system for bedding and clothing".
As a result, a large number of soldiers commented and complained that the current bedding and clothing application system has a large number of zero inventory, out of stock, and non-delivery, and it is suspected that there is a shortage of basic supplies.
PS: It is worth noting that each comment on the public account article needs to be manually screened by the administrator before it is displayed.
